Blog.post: good jesus. did anyone catch the license plate on that truck? you know... the one that ran me over last night. went to dragonfly with my roommate when he got back into town last night. for those of you not from DC, or not familiar with dragonfly- it is a very swank, upscale lounge in midtown, and everything on the inside is bright white (quite a stunning visual effect, actually). great martinis there. and beers, and shots. it struck me last night that there are certain bars where no one gets picked up and no one picks anyone up. Maybe not entire bars, but definitely nights in certain bars. We were upstairs, so I can't vouge for downstairs, but- it was nothing but groups of 2-8 beautiful people (and i mean, there were some truley gorgeous people in there) talking exclusively within their groups. not once did we see a single instance of intra-group interaction. very, very odd. the yuppies were there to see and be seen last night, and little else. we were there to get drunk.

3:00 pm, back from the power lunch- Washington DC style. Two hours of martinis and good food at the famed Old Ebbit Grill, my friends, it just doesn't get any better than that. Lunch is merely an appetizer to happy hour in DC- God, I love this town!

The Brittish Open is on today, and its shaping up to be a great tourney. Tiger trying to capture the calendar Slam, Faldo has won two open championships on this course before ('92 and '86 I believe), Sergio won the Euro Amatuer here 4 years ago, and the field is packed with guys like Harrington and the Goose, who are just nasty on links courses. It should be interesting this weekend when the wind is gusting at 45 mph and there is a steady rain. I know its kind of foolish to bet on anyone but Tiger, but I couldn't resist Harrington at 28-1 and Faldo at 66-1. Obviously not a safe bet, but I think the odds are better than the bookies are offering. Also, watch out for Nicky Price who has been cruising along doing nothing spectacular and making top ten after top ten. Nate's golf betting column will return in August for the PGA Championship...

how does one convey the personal importance of daily events in a medium like this? a folder was just deleted off of a networked drive at my office. does this mean anything to anyone out there? does anyone care? does it matter that there were months of work in that folder? does it matter that the folder was backed up as recently as last night? does it matter that i almost dry heaved in my trash can when i heard of its deletion because of the work that was represented in that folder? certainly it does to me, all of that is important to me. but why does it carry any relevance to anyone who would be reading this. are our collective voyeristic tendencies strong enough to outweigh the fact that this information is completely and totally inconsequential? apparently they are, and the blogging goes on.

the novelty of blogging is getting in the way of me writing open, honest blogs. I really feel like this is window dressing- the small talk at a cocktail party, chit chat on an elevator. speaking of which, has anyone actually been to a cocktail party? i picture aristocrats standing around in $5000 suits and beaded gowns sipping martinis- but maybe i'm off on this. anyway, i think that once this becomes more of a habit (cause I don't have enough of those) the blogs will get better. or maybe i just need to sip a few more martinis- bottoms up!

The NFL- its FAAAAAAAN-tastic (apologies to the NBA, and Bill Simmons).
ok, now that we've gotten that out of the way. i will have nothing interesting to say on here for at least 24 hours. of course, i don't think any of this was very interesting to begin with.
